name: Little  studs
description:
My fresh approach to contemporary jewellery is inspired by photographs of my local surroundings,  from which I abstract to create feminine, wearable and tactile accessories. Using a refined photo etching technique I pay homage to traditional dark room photography, taking my own narrative photography and translating it into pieces that will last a lifetime. I use only the highest quality, hallmarked sterling silver and 18ct gold Vermeil. Each piece is 100% handmade by me in my studio near St Andrews, Scotland. My work has already been featured in the likes of Plog Magazine, Fake Magazine and on Channel4.com


A quirky pair of earrings, with a slight vintage feel to them. Incorporating an adorable bunting effect on the surface.  They are perfect for everyday wear. 


Made in sterling silver, oxidised to highlight the pattern. 

Measuring approx 0.5cm x 1.2cm


(Earrings sold in single pair)

name: The rail bridge ring
description:
Using imagery from the old Tay rail bridge crossing over from Fife to Dundee. This ring has a strong architectural feel about it. 

My fresh approach to contemporary jewellery is inspired by photographs of my local surroundings,  from which I abstract to create feminine, wearable and tactile accessories. Using a refined photo etching technique I pay homage to traditional dark room photography, taking my own narrative photography and translating it into pieces that will last a lifetime. I use only the highest quality, hallmarked sterling silver and 18ct gold Vermeil. Each piece is 100% handmade by me in my studio near St Andrews, Scotland. My work has already been featured in the likes of Plog Magazine, Fake Magazine and on Channel4.com


Silver oxidised to highlight pattern- square measuring roughly 2x2cm. 

This could be your statement ring that you wear every day.

name: the rail bridge
description:
A mid length necklace using a delicate silver trace chain. using a manipulated pattern from a rail bridge image. 


My fresh approach to contemporary jewellery is inspired by photographs of my local surroundings,  from which I abstract to create feminine, wearable and tactile accessories. Using a refined photo etching technique I pay homage to traditional dark room photography, taking my own narrative photography and translating it into pieces that will last a lifetime. I use only the highest quality, hallmarked sterling silver and 18ct gold Vermeil. Each piece is 100% handmade by me in my studio near St Andrews, Scotland. My work has already been featured in the likes of Plog Magazine, Fake Magazine and on Channel4.com




.

name: the bandstand round
description:
Long silver necklace, hinged on four sides to create a playful tactile piece of jewellery. 


The imagery used is the 'trimming' photographed off an old bandstand in St Andrews not so long ago. The symmetrical nature of the pattern creates a  wonderful repeating pattern.



The pendant measures about 2cm (squared) and is oxidised to give it the gun metal, steel grey effect.

name: little bunting cubes
description:
Dip (oxi)dyed drop silver earrings (that's a tongue twisting selection  of words huh? )


These hollow silver cubes are a playful but dramatic earring.  The cubes have one side open and exposed as well as on another side of the cube you will find a subtle bunting style photo etch. 

Using platinol on the silver we can create this gun metal effect.


The cubes measure around 0.5 cm(squared) and the chain measure roughly 4cm long. 

If you'd like any alterations to the length of the drop chain please don't hesitate to get in touch. 


PLEASE NOTE: This piece is made to order so please allow UP TO 7 working days for making.

name: the townhouse ring
description:
'the townhouse ring' is a classic. 


The Georgian style houses are a common site in many cities throughout the UK and they  are undeniably luxurious and handsome. 

These rings  measuring about 2cm x 2cm are a a perfect ring for everyday but can easily merge from day to evening wear. 


Available oxidised or white silver. 



All jewellery is MADE TO ORDER please allow 5-7 working days for making.

name: the bandstand cubes
description:
little cubed earrings, hollow on one side etched on the opposite side showing the remnants of a pattern sourced from a bandstand.


Silver, measuring 0.6x0.6cmx0.6cm

Oxidised to create an aged effect.


PLEASE NOTE: All work is made to order so please allow up to 7 working days for making.

name: the rail bridge necklace.
description:
An upside down rail bridge necklace.


This long silver trace chain necklace is joined to a hinged, photo etched, silver railbridge. Oxidised to accentuate the the rail bridge details , or available in just silver, a subtle but elegant touch.

Measuring 4x2cm approx.

name: the townhouse studs
description:
Ever worn a townhouse stud in your ear? Now you can.


Based on photographs taken from St Andrews these little townhouse studs will remind you of the Georgian townhouse you might find in Edinburgh or Bath.

Measuring about 1cm wide, oxidised (Blackened) to highlight the etched image made from silver.

name: little rail bridge studs
description:
a little bridge in your ears. 


Silver earrings measuring approx  1x1cm, using etched imagery of a rail bridge, oxidised to give the gun metal grey colouring within the bridge.

name: bandstand ring
description:
Using a pattern that decorated the top of the St Andrews bandstand,this ring is made for you.


Silver ring with the top measuring 2x2cm approx. Image formed on metal using a photo etching process. Can be made in any size.

PLEASE NOTE: Work is made to order so please allow up to 7 working days for making.

name: little bunting cube studs
description:
Hollow silver studs measuring about 0.5cm (squared)


On one side you will find an quirky etch reminiscent of hanging bunting and on another side you will find it open exposing the hollow inside. 


Using platinol I oxidise (blacken) the metal to so that the etch has a beautiful steel grey colour.

name: townhouse in st.andrews
description:
Long hinged Necklace reminiscent of Edinburgh and Bath but in fact images from the small Scottish town, St Andrews.

Using photo etching techniques I can etch imagery onto metal using photo polymer film, UV exposure units and a dilute nitric acid. 


The hinges create a playful, collapsable necklace.
